low: Low water balance makes fish get sick more easily and reduces how many fish you can harvest
Too-low water balance slows fish growth and they don't eat as much, delaying harvests
Water balance below normal hurts fish breathing and they die from the stress
Too-low balance affects fish egg laying and baby fish numbers, reducing your overall fish crop
Unbalanced water changes the natural chemicals in fish, making fewer eggs hatch
Too-low water balance gives fish stomach problems, cutting down on growth
Unbalanced water makes it hard for fish to build strong bodies and protect their skin
Very low balance makes fish act strange and stop eating properly
Too-low water balance builds up harmful waste and poisons the fish, killing many
Unbalanced water kills the good germs that help break down food for your plants
high: High water balance slows fish growth and makes them not taste as good when harvested
Too-high water balance makes important food bits too hard for fish to use, affecting their skin and bones
Water balance above normal hurts fish breathing parts, making it hard to get oxygen
Too-high balance stops fish from producing good eggs and baby fish, lowering harvest numbers
High water level locks away important food bits, making fish hungry and weak
Too-high balance allows harmful waste to hurt fish more easily, causing many deaths
Water extremes make fish lose balance and float strangely in the water
High balance slows fish digestion and they don't grow as fast from their food
Too-high water grows bad algae that poisons fish and hurts plant health
Unbalanced water reduces good algae needed to feed your plants properly
